text: William Donaldson Ballard (March 15, 1927 – July 2, 2019) was an American politician in the state of Georgia. During World War II, Ballard served in the United States Navy as a demolition expert aboard the LST-1076. Ballard attended the University of Georgia and was an attorney. In 2012, Ballard marked 60 years of active law practice. Ballard died July 2, 2019. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Members of the Georgia House of Representatives Category:Georgia (U.S. state) state senators Category:University of Georgia School of Law alumni Category:Georgia (U.S. state) Democrats Category:People from Newton County, Georgia Category:Military personnel from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Georgia (U.S. state) lawyers
title: Don Ballard
